author: jgm
content:
Deflation is generally considered to be the situation where both incoming and outgoing numbers decrease.  Disinflation occurs when the incoming number decreases but the outgoing number does not.

(Although there are various disagreements on these terms, because economists.)

author: jgm
content:
Following up on this: the "rewards" for being in a sync committee are a significant part of a validator's yearly income.  I don't think that having this be down to simple luck is a good thing at all.

<@!340345049063882753> said that he didn't like the idea of validators being paid for doing nothing, but in my mind this is by far the lesser evil compared to a system with such high levels of variability on an individual validator's income.  And it gives us a reserve pool of "ready and waiting" validators to pull from when the next piece of functionality requires a validator.

If you think of the 8/64 reward for non-members of the sync committee as being "was ready to sign but didn't". for members of the sync committee as being "was ready to sign and did", and no reward for "was not ready to sign when required" it doesn't seem so bad.
